author: Mona Charen
title: Justice Alito gets caught by an undercover activist - Chicago Sun-Times
text: Justice Alito has a chip on his shoulder A filmmaker and activist secretly recorded Alito at a dinner. Public officials, especially judges, won‚Äôt get into trouble if they maintain their composure and remember not to enlist in the culture wars. I am not a fan of hidden microphone ambushes. It‚Äôs sneaky and dishonest. The kind of ambush that journalist and activist Lauren Windsor pulled off at the recent Supreme Court Historical Society dinner was particularly unseemly because she posed as a conservative activist type and attempted to lead the witnesses ‚Äî Supreme Court justices and spouses ‚Äî into saying something clickbaity that could be shopped to an ideological ally in the press. Windsor, a progressive, is taking a leaf from James O‚ÄôKeefe‚Äôs playbook. Windsor struck out with Chief Justice John Roberts. The country was living through ‚Äútumultuous‚Äù times, she suggested, and wondered what the court could do to repair the polarization. Roberts was dubious. ‚ÄúThe first thing ... is to tell me when the non-tumultuous time has been ... you look at what the court was doing in the 1960s, what the court was doing during the New Deal, what the court was doing after Dred Scott ... ‚Äú Windsor persisted, asking whether the justice thinks it‚Äôs part of the court‚Äôs role to ‚Äúguide us back toward a more moral path?‚Äù The chief justice‚Äôs response was pitch perfect: ‚ÄúNo. The role of the court is deciding cases. If I start, would you want to put me in charge of guiding us toward a more moral path? That‚Äôs for the people we elect. That‚Äôs not for lawyers.‚Äù Finally, Roberts denied that we are a ‚ÄúChristian nation,‚Äù noting that Jewish and Muslim Americans would beg to differ. Columnists In-depth political coverage, sports analysis, entertainment reviews and cultural commentary. Roberts demonstrated historical perspective, modesty about the court‚Äôs role (and his own), and clear impatience with the idea that the court should serve as some sort of Sanhedrin for American society. Windsor used the same tactics with Justice Samuel Alito and got a different result. She began by praising him as a ‚Äúfighter‚Äù and then proposed that as a Catholic herself, she doesn‚Äôt know if we can ‚Äúreally negotiate with the left in a way that needs to happen for the polarization to end‚Äù and that ‚Äúit‚Äôs a matter of like, winning.‚Äù He agreed. ‚ÄúOne side or the other is going to win. I don‚Äôt know.‚Äù It‚Äôs easy to read too much into a few stray responses to an agent provocateur. Alito said, ‚ÄúI agree with you‚Äù several times. Was that what he really meant? It‚Äôs possible that he was just being polite or was trying to get rid of her and get to the bar or the parking lot. And while he did say that there are ‚Äúdifferences on fundamental things that cannot be compromised,‚Äù he also said that there are ways of ‚Äúworking, living together peacefully.‚Äù But this recording, coming on the heels of the flag stories ‚Äî and Alito‚Äôs peevish Wall Street Journal article denying that he violated ethics rules when he accepted lavish gifts and declined to report them on financial disclosure forms or recuse himself from cases tangentially related to a benefactor ‚Äî begin to paint a picture of a justice with a chip on his shoulder. Justices should avoid ‚Äòculture wars‚Äô Every public figure, for better or worse, needs to assume that nothing they say outside their own homes is truly private. Just ask Barack ‚ÄúI‚Äôll have more flexibility after the election‚Äù Obama or Mitt ‚Äú47 percent‚Äù Romney about open mics and surreptitious recordings. At the same time, as Roberts demonstrated, public officials, especially judges, won‚Äôt get into trouble if they maintain their composure and remember not to enlist in the culture wars. Alito should be above agreeing that one side or the other must ‚Äúwin‚Äù in our current disputes. That‚Äôs too close to the kind of Flight 93 talk that has so distorted the right‚Äôs perspective on public policy. The most important thing for a justice to stress is process. We won‚Äôt agree on everything, but as long as we obey the law and work out compromises in our existing institutions, we remain strong. As long as everyone has a chance to express their views, vote their conscience and have their rights respected, we‚Äôll be OK. Talk of existential crises is dangerous. Alito is not responsible for the views of his wife, but her unguarded remarks were particularly unfortunate. She isn‚Äôt confirmed for anything, and yet, she still has a role to play in our system. For the sake of the court‚Äôs stature and legitimacy, it‚Äôs important that no one so closely associated with one of the nine justices betray so much animus toward people on the other side of the political spectrum. Asked about the flags she flew over their Virginia and New Jersey homes, Martha-Ann Alito was caustic. ‚ÄúI want a Sacred Heart of Jesus flag because I have to look across the lagoon at the pride flag for the next month.‚Äù Sorry, but having to see symbols and language you disagree with is the basic requirement of life in a free society. Also, Mrs. Alito‚Äôs anger about it seems grossly misplaced. If someone were flying a swastika or hammer-and-sickle flag (which would also be legal), her rage would be understandable. But the pride flag? We live in a diverse, free and often raucous country. Justices of the Supreme Court and their families cannot be expected to be untouched by passion or partisanship. But they can model respect for differing views and commitment to compromise. Mona Charen is policy editor of The Bulwark and host of the ‚ÄúBeg to Differ‚Äù podcast. High school students weigh in on Biden-Trump debate: 'It seems a lot more civil than previous debates'

author: Joel B. Pollak
title: IDF Kills Hezbollah Drone Chief
text:
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) announced Thursday that it had killed Hezbollah‚Äôs drone commander, Muhammad Hussein Srour, in a precision airstrike in Beirut, Lebanon.
In a statement, the IDF said:
The IDF Spokesperson Unit announces that today (Thursday), September 26th 2024, with the direction of IDF intelligence, the IAF struck and eliminated the terrorist Muhammad Hussein Srour in Beirut.
Srour advanced and directed numerous aerial terror attacks, including drone attacks, cruise missiles, and UAVs aimed at the people of Israel.
In recent years, Srour led the manufacturing project of UAVs in southern Lebanon and established UAV manufacturing and intelligence gathering sites in Lebanon, located adjacent to civilian infrastructure in Beirut, as well as areas in southern Lebanon.
Srour joined Hezbollah in the 1980‚Äôs and held several roles within the terrorist organization, including commander in the surface-to-air missile unit, commander in the ‚ÄúAziz‚Äù Unit of the Radwan Force, as well as Hezbollah‚Äôs emissary to Yemen and the Houthi terrorist regime‚Äôs Aerial Command.
During the ‚ÄúIron Swords‚Äù war, he promoted and executed several terrorist attacks against Israeli civilians and IDF soldiers using UAVs and explosive devices.
The IDF will continue to operate to undermine Hezbollah‚Äôs capabilities and to dismantle the terrorist organization‚Äôs top command.
The IDF‚Äôs Hebrew-language account on X (formerly Twitter) published footage of the airstrike:
Israel announced the successful airstrike as Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu‚Äôs office rejected reports that Israel had accepted a 21-day ceasefire proposed by France, the U.S., and other nations and announced by the White House.
Joel B. Pollak is Senior Editor-at-Large at Breitbart News and the host of Breitbart News Sunday on Sirius XM Patriot on Sunday evenings from 7 p.m. to 10 p.m. ET (4 p.m. to 7 p.m. PT). He is the author of The Agenda: What Trump Should Do in His First 100 Days , available for pre-order on Amazon. He is also the author of The Trumpian Virtues: The Lessons and Legacy of Donald Trump‚Äôs Presidency , now available on Audible. He is a winner of the 2018 Robert Novak Journalism Alumni Fellowship. Follow him on Twitter at @joelpollak .
Israel / Middle East National Security Politics Hezbollah Israel Israel Defense Forces (IDF) Lebanon Terror

author: AAP
title: Teenage boy killed by shark at remote South Australia beach
text: A teenage boy has died after being bitten by a shark at a remote beach on South Australia's Yorke Peninsula. Emergency services were called to Ethel Beach in Innes National Park with reports of a shark attack at 1.30pm on Thursday. There, at the popular surf beach hemmed in by towering cliffs, they recovered the teenager's body. Local surfer Luke Sykora spoke of his shock over the tragedy. "I have a seen a fair few sharks here over 22 years, but that is the first fatal attack that we've had down here," he told ABC News. "I wouldn't wish it upon anyone ‚Ä¶ to even be at the same beach at the same time. "I think the town would be mourning. I think it's very sad and very tragic and a bit of an eye-opener." The attack comes after a spate of serious shark bites in recent months, including the fatal attack of 55-year-old Tod Gendle at Granites Beach on the state's West Coast in October. His was the second shark death this year after 46-year-old teacher Simon Baccanello disappeared without a trace in May while surfing at Walkers Rock Beach, about 365km west of Adelaide. Police are preparing a report for the coroner.

author: VNExplorer
title: Derrick Henry thanks Titans fans 'for the 8 greatest years of my life'
text:
Andrew Nelles / The Tennessean / USA TODAY NETWORK
After leading the Tennessee Titans to a win over the Jacksonville Jaguars in what could be his last game with the team, Derrick Henry expressed his appreciation for the fans who have supported him.
Henry fittingly torched the Jaguars to the tune of 153 yards and a touchdown in the 28-20 victory, which also knocked Jacksonville out of the playoffs in what is a hugely disappointing result for Tennessee‚Äôs division rival.
As far as Henry‚Äôs future is concerned, it isn‚Äôt clear if the Titans will bring one of the best players in franchise history back for another season. The Alabama product made one hell of a case they should on Sunday.
After the game, Henry was given the mic on the field and had a message for Titans fans. He sure sounded like someone who doesn‚Äôt expect to be back in 2024.
‚ÄúTitans fans, I want to thank you for the eight greatest years of my life,‚Äù he said, per The Athletic‚Äôs Joe Rexrode.
You can check out his full speech below.
‚ÄúThank you for the greatest 8 years of my life‚Äù
-Derrick Henry thanks @Titans fans after his last potential game as a Titan üëë pic.twitter.com/aSuERdlSFj
‚Äî FOX Sports: NFL (@NFLonFOX) January 7, 2024
Thank you, 22.
More Latest News

Titans RB Derrick Henry breaks franchise record vs. Jags
Titans vs. Jaguars inactives for Week 18: Who‚Äôs in, who‚Äôs out?
Titans can end Jaguars‚Äô season with Week 18 win

author: Paulo Correia
title: Conhe√ßa a exposi√ß√£o tempor√°ria de tape√ßarias e desenhos em Set√∫bal - Margem Sul
text:
O Museu de Arqueologia e Etnografia do Distrito de Set√∫bal (MAEDS) prepara-se para receber uma nova e emocionante exposi√ß√£o tempor√°ria intitulada ‚ÄúGestos Entrela√ßados‚Äù. Esta mostra, que foi inaugurada a 7 de junho, promete trazer uma nova perspectiva sobre a arte contempor√¢nea, destacando a intersec√ß√£o entre tape√ßarias e desenhos.
O Museu de Arqueologia e Etnografia do Distrito de Set√∫bal
Fundado em 1974, o MAEDS ocupa um edif√≠cio hist√≥rico do s√©culo XVIII e posiciona-se como um espa√ßo dedicado √† mem√≥ria e √† cultura da regi√£o. Com um acervo diversificado que abrange tanto a arqueologia como a etnografia, o museu tamb√©m abriga obras de arte contempor√¢nea, refletindo a riqueza cultural de Set√∫bal.
O acervo do MAEDS √© not√°vel pela sua representatividade da hist√≥ria local, incluindo artefatos arqueol√≥gicos e etnogr√°ficos. A exposi√ß√£o permanente √© dividida em dois setores principais: um dedicado √† arqueologia e outro √† etnografia. Al√©m disso, o museu atua como um centro de estudos arqueol√≥gicos, promovendo pesquisas e atividades educativas.
A Exposi√ß√£o ‚ÄúGestos Entrela√ßados‚Äù
Anualmente, o MAEDS organiza uma s√©rie de exposi√ß√µes tempor√°rias que ampliam o seu alcance cultural. A nova exposi√ß√£o ‚ÄúGestos Entrela√ßados‚Äù √© uma dessas iniciativas, que visa destacar a arte contempor√¢nea e as suas diversas formas de express√£o.
A exposi√ß√£o ‚ÄúGestos Entrela√ßados‚Äù apresenta obras da artista Guida Fonseca, que utiliza t√©cnicas de tape√ßaria, e da desenhista Teresa Melo, que traz uma abordagem √∫nica ao desenho. Ambas as artistas exploram a rela√ß√£o entre gesto, mat√©ria e tempo, criando um di√°logo sens√≠vel entre as suas obras.
Artistas em destaque:
- Guida Fonseca: Conhecida pelas suas tape√ßarias, Guida utiliza fios e texturas para contar hist√≥rias visuais que refletem a cultura e a identidade. A sua obra ‚ÄúEntre fios e tempos‚Äù √© um exemplo perfeito de como a tape√ßaria pode ser uma forma de express√£o art√≠stica rica e complexa.
- Teresa Melo: Com um enfoque no desenho, Teresa apresenta ‚ÄúEntre o caos e a harmonia‚Äù, onde as suas cria√ß√µes visuais dialogam com a obra de Guida, criando uma experi√™ncia imersiva para os visitantes.
As obras de Guida e Teresa n√£o coexistem apenas, mas tamb√©m se entrela√ßam num di√°logo √≠ntimo. A intera√ß√£o entre as t√©cnicas de tape√ßaria e desenho proporciona uma nova dimens√£o √† experi√™ncia art√≠stica, convidando o p√∫blico a refletir sobre a rela√ß√£o entre o gesto criativo e a transforma√ß√£o da mat√©ria.
A inaugura√ß√£o da exposi√ß√£o foi um evento aberto ao p√∫blico. Os visitantes podem explorar as obras de Guida Fonseca e Teresa Melo at√© dia 23 de agosto. Este √© um convite para todos que desejam aprofundar na arte contempor√¢nea e na cultura local.
A exposi√ß√£o ‚ÄúGestos Entrela√ßados‚Äù √© uma celebra√ß√£o da criatividade e da express√£o art√≠stica contempor√¢nea. Com a participa√ß√£o de artistas como Guida Fonseca e Teresa Melo, o MAEDS reafirma-se como um espa√ßo vital para a cultura em Set√∫bal. N√£o perca a oportunidade de visitar e de se deixar envolver por esta experi√™ncia que une arte, hist√≥ria e comunidade.

author: R√©seau International
title: Le autorit√† di Gaza accusano Israele di aver rubato organi da corpi palestinesi
text: - supporto R√©seau International Abbiamo bisogno di te da Nour Abou Eisha Marted√¨ sera le autorit√† locali di Gaza hanno accusato Israele di aver rubato organi da corpi palestinesi, chiedendo un'indagine internazionale sulla questione. In una dichiarazione, l'ufficio stampa governativo con sede a Gaza ha affermato che l'esame dei corpi ha rivelato che le loro forme erano cambiate in modo significativo a causa del furto di organi vitali dai cadaveri. Ha aggiunto che l‚Äôesercito israeliano ha consegnato corpi non identificati alle autorit√† palestinesi e si √® rifiutato di specificare dove sono stati ritrovati. La stessa fonte ha anche indicato che l'esercito israeliano ha ripetuto un simile atto durante la guerra in corso contro Gaza e ha anche riesumato i corpi dai cimiteri. Il comunicato critica ci√≤ che dice‚Äùl‚Äôatteggiamento silenzioso delle organizzazioni internazionali che operano a Gaza, compreso il Comitato Internazionale della Croce Rossa, di fronte a un crimine cos√¨ orribile commesso dall‚Äôoccupazione (israeliana)'. Le autorit√† israeliane non hanno ancora commentato queste accuse. Marted√¨, le autorit√† israeliane hanno consegnato i corpi di dozzine di palestinesi uccisi dall‚Äôesercito israeliano e detenuti durante l‚Äôoperazione di terra. Il Ministero della Sanit√† di Gaza ha ricevuto i corpi attraverso il valico di frontiera di Kerem Shalom nel sud della Striscia di Gaza, ha detto un corrispondente di Gaza.Anadolu sur le terrain. Il Ministero delle dotazioni e degli affari religiosi di Gaza √® stato responsabile della loro sepoltura in fosse comuni, ha riferito il corrispondente. ¬´L'ONU ci ha informato in anticipo dell'arrivo di un numero di martiri nella Striscia di Gaza, stimato in circa 80 corpi‚Äú, disse a Anadolu Marwan Al-Hams, direttore dell'ospedale Mohammed Yousef El-Najar della citt√† di Rafah. ¬´I corpi sono arrivati in un contenitore, alcuni intatti, altri invece erano a pezzi ed altri ancora decompostiHa aggiunto. fonte: [Agenzia Anadolu](https://www.aa.com.tr/fr/monde/les-autorit%C3%A9s-de-gaza-accusent-isra%C3%ABl-de-voler-les-organes-des-corps-de-palestiniens/3093341)

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Damning report hits out at UK weight-loss clinic that secretly filmed clients
text:
By Dave Higgens ,
31 minutes ago Getty Images A cosmetic and weight loss clinic that secretly filmed patients is ‚Äúnot safe‚Äù, the health watchdog has found.
A damning report from the Care Quality Commission (CQC) found that Doncaster-based Elements Medical was inadequate in every area it inspected in October, concluding it was ‚Äúnot safe‚Äù, ‚Äúnot effective‚Äù and ‚Äúnot well led‚Äù.
The clinic, which also operates online as The Virtual Slimming Clinic, offers services including weight management, pre and postoperative care for cosmetic and bariatric surgery , treatments for skin conditions including acne, and vitamin injections, the CQC said on Friday.
Among the long list of concerns, the report said: ‚ÄúWe saw that people were covertly filmed at the premises including while receiving treatment, without their knowledge or consent.
‚ÄúIn addition, the provider told us that the closed-circuit television monitoring (CCTV) was monitored and managed by a third-party provider which posed a safeguarding risk.‚Äù
The inspectors said they found a large quantity of the muscular injection Dysport in a fridge which was turned off during clinic times because it was noisy.
The report said: ‚ÄúStaff told us this medicine had been imported from Turkey, and we found labels on the medicine were not in English, however, the provider did not have a licence to import any medicines to England.
‚ÄúTurkey is also not an approved country for the purposes of supplying medicines for use in England by the Medicines Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA).‚Äù
The report continued: ‚ÄúWe also found the provider was using this injection in place of Botox, however, people using the service had not been informed of this.
‚ÄúWe saw evidence that vials which were meant for single use only were being shared between multiple patients, which posed a significant infection risk.‚Äù
The inspectors also said that the firm bought the dilutant Bacteriostatic sodium chloride 0.9% from a website which said: ‚ÄúAll products listed on this website are for research purposes only, we do not advocate or advise human use, and any such use is entirely at your own risk.‚Äù
They pointed to a series of other safety concerns, including obstructed fire exits, ‚Äúlit candles in clinic and waiting rooms which were unattended for significant periods of time‚Äù, unsafely stored oxygen, and a defibrillator with no pads which left it ‚Äúnot usable in the event of an emergency‚Äù.
The report concluded that the provider showed ‚Äúa disregard for the safety of staff and people using the service and staff, confidentiality, and information security‚Äù.
It said: ‚ÄúThe CQC assessment team did not feel that all staff, including the provider, acted with openness, honesty and transparency during the inspection visit.
‚ÄúThere was a disregard for the duty of candour. Where people had been placed at significant risk of harm by the service, we saw no evidence that they had been informed of this.‚Äù
The CQC said it did not inspect how caring or responsive the service was, as it focused on the areas of concern, and these areas both remain rated as good from the previous inspection.
Being placed in special measures means the service will be kept under close review by CQC, the watchdog said.
Alan Stephenson, CQC deputy director of operations in the north, said: ‚ÄúWhen we inspected Elements Medical, we had serious concerns about the safety of the service and how it was being managed, to ensure people were getting the service and treatment they deserve.
‚ÄúWe identified widespread shortfalls including people‚Äôs understanding of procedures and their consent to them, and how the service kept people safe from abuse.
‚ÄúStaff lacked basic knowledge of safeguarding procedures, including how to report concerns, and the service secretly filmed people during treatment without consent.‚Äù
Mr Stephenson said: ‚ÄúWe have told Elements Medical where we expect to see rapid and widespread improvements and will continue to monitor them closely to keep people safe while this happens.
‚ÄúWe will return to check on their progress and won‚Äôt hesitate to take further action if people are not receiving the care they have a right to expect.‚Äù
The report will be published on CQC‚Äôs website in the next few days.

author: Findeton
title: #51 Fe, familia y odio al progresismo: el poder de los evang√©licos latinos se extiende por Estados Unidos
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#4](c4#c-4) Es una manera de verlo. Otra es que unos cuantos espa√±oles se han marchado a pa√≠ses menos corruptos, han visto que se vive mejor as√≠ y evitan votar a los partidos que mantienen aqu√≠ niveles indecentes de corrupci√≥n.
Pero hay de todo‚Ä¶
[#4](c4#c-4) te recomiendo algo m√°s de fibra en tu dieta, parece que a√∫n no has digerido el que no ganaran los tuyos
[#4](c4#c-4) que yo conozca la gente que emigra a EEUU normalmente son gente con t√≠tulos superiores donde irse a Am√©rica es muy buena opci√≥n laboral, y ya esta, si votan a la izquierda espa√±ola sera porque ven desde fuera que es mejor opci√≥n.
Que pasa con los que votan a la derecha?
Que significaria?
Por cierto a mayor nivel de estudios el votante de izquierda aumenta, tampoco dices nada de eso?
[#37](c37#c-37) Ay pobres comunistas que el problema que tienen es que son dependientes de importar todo de EEUU.
Pues que sepas que la mayor√≠a del pollo en Cuba viene de Miami, el embargo est√° hoy en d√≠a muy limitado.
Ah, y en la guerra fr√≠a hab√≠a m√°s gente en el bloque comunista que en el bloque capitalista.. y aun as√≠ al bloque capitalista le iba mil veces mejor y no necesitaban para nada a los comunistas.
[#1](c1#c-1) No veo relaci√≥n entre el fanatismo religioso cristiano y los problemas pol√≠tico sociales en latinoam√©rica.
El Salvador es de los pa√≠ses m√°s evang√©licos, junto a Brasil, y las cosas les han empezado a ir bien.
Argentina y Venezuela no son pa√≠ses de corte religioso evang√©lico y est√°n comiendo mierda.
En Cuba ni religiosos son, y no tienen ni para comer mierda.
[#33](c33#c-33) derecha y diosito van siempre juntitos, si te convenzo que est√°s en la tierra para sufrir a cambio de una recompensa cuando te mueras, aguantas mejor que te pisen, porque a mayor sufrimiento mayor recompensa
[#33](c33#c-33) Simple, estos tipos se oponen al planamiento familiar.
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4449999/
[#1](c1#c-1) por no hablar de que sus antepasados se arrancar√≠an los pelos de desesperaci√≥n por ver como han abrazado la religi√≥n que los masacr√≥
Y los testigos de Jehov√°. Antes estaban a la salida de los hospitales con sus plafones. Ahora los veo en: la salida del metro, de los parques y en cualquier esquina o paseo. De 3 en 3. Si no les miras no te molestan, al menos en mi experiencia, pero me parece preocupante c√≥mo van invadiendo el espacio p√∫blico para su negocio de proselitismo religioso. ¬øPuedo plantar un plaf√≥n con folletos de mi empresa 7 u 8 horas all√° d√≥nde me apetezca y abordar a los transe√∫ntes?
[#3](c3#c-3) al igual que llevan toda la vida ocupando espacio publico los mendigos, los que reparten folletos, los grupos de turistas guiados.... mientras la ocupacion no sea permanente, no hay problema
[#3](c3#c-3) En mi peque√±a ciudad de 40k habitantes el otro d√≠a me cruc√© a cuatro as√≠, todos eran latinos. Les dije con palabras poco amables que se fueran con sus historias a su templo, que la calle no era lugar para ello. Eran muy rid√≠culos, hablaban con una grandiosidad t√≠pica de pastor evang√©lico y que si la gloria de dios y mierdas as√≠. Llam√© a la polic√≠a. Me parece sumamente preocupante esto. Uno de ellos a√∫n ven√≠a con ese falso buen rollo a "debatir" conmigo y me hac√≠a preguntas de lo m√°s rid√≠culas. Largo de la calle por favor.
[#21](c21#c-21) y que pas√≥ cuando llamaste a la polic√≠a? Que te dijeron los guardias? conseguiste que se fueran?
[#42](c42#c-42) Se fueron a la hora aproximadamente, pero no s√© si por su propio pie o por la polic√≠a, ya que yo volv√≠ donde ellos media hora larga despu√©s y ah√≠ segu√≠an. La poli dijo que iba a mandar una patrulla y vi un coche una hora despu√©s de llamarles, pero capaz que iban a otro sitio, as√≠ que no puedo confirmar. Me ol√≠a que estos predicadores eran evang√©licos pagados por alguien de aqu√≠ o de all√° para hacer la ruta, porque el brasile√±o ten√≠a un acento incre√≠ble y hablaba espa√±ol justo.
[#3](c3#c-3) pero esos, "por fortuna", son tan radicales que no van a ser mayor√≠a nunca y hasta la fecha no se meten en pol√≠tica. Por lo dem√°s, totalmente de acuerdo.
Yo lo llamar√≠a "fe seudocristiana", porque muchas veces esto no est√° movido por una fe religiosa, sino que la fe religiosa es solo el medio para mover otra cosa, por ejemplo, mantener a la gente distra√≠da odiando el aborto o a los homosexuales mientras no se dan cuenta de que otros se est√°n quedando con la mayor parte de su esfuerzo al trabajar.
